result.execSummary:
The defendant John D Bruette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Deg.Sex. Assault/Mentally Ill Victim, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court IMPOSES  and STAYS a sentence of 8 years in the Wisconsin State Prison, consisting of 4 years Initial Confinement and 4 years Extended Supervision
The Court places the Defendant on Probation for 10 years

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge  

--to pay outstanding court appointed attorney fees

***PER 4-10-17 ORDER - Order for payment of Atty. David Zarwell as appointed defense counsel in the amount of $5366.40. ***

--The defendant shall undergo a Psychosexual Evaluation, and follow through with any recommended treatment/therapy as directed by DOC

***PER 3-21-17 ORDER JOC IS AMENDED TO READ : The defendant shall undergo a Psychosexual Evaluation if directed by DOC and follow through with any recommended treatment/therapy as directed by DOC***

--The defendant shall not have direct/indirect contact with A.C.H., nor shall he be present at her residence or any location temporarily occupied by her,unless approved by BOTH the Department of Corrections and the parents of A.C.H.

--The defendant shall not have any unsupervised contact with any minor children, without prior approval ofthe DOC

--Any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling per agent

--The defendant shall comply with Sex Offender registration and reporting requirements

--The defendant shall be responsible for future psychological, psychiatric, or mental health treatment costs for A.C.H. up to a maximum of $10,000.00 pursuant to 973.20(4m) Wis. Stats

--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

--If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY: Johnson Creek PD

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John D Bruette

records.addlTxt:
[MA]Case called at 2:55pm
Defendant John D Bruette in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Theresa Beck  appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Monitor with Real Time displayed is provided for Mr. Bruette

Atty. Zarwell requests that Psychosexual Evaluation Report be sealed; the Court advises that the document has already been sealed.

ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance
Sentencing arguments given by ADA Beck
Statements made by parents of victim
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Zarwell

The Court IMPOSES  and STAYS a sentence of 8 years in the Wisconsin State Prison, consisting of 4 years Initial Confinement and 4 years Extended Supervision

The Court places the Defendant on Probation for 10 years, with conditions:

--The defendant shall undergo a Psychosexual Evaluation, and follow through with any recommended treatment/therapy as directed by DOC
--The defendant shall not have direct/indirect contact with A.C.H., nor shall he be present at her residence or any location temporarily occupied by her,unless approved by BOTH the Department of Corrections and the parents of A.C.H.
--The defendant shall not have any unsupervised contact with any minor children, without prior approval ofthe DOC
--Any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling per agent
--The defendant shall comply with Sex Offender registration and reporting requirements
--The defendant shall be responsible for future psychological, psychiatric, or mental health treatment costs for A.C.H. up to a maximum of $10,000.00 pursuant to 973.20(4m) Wis. Stats
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge  
--to pay outstanding court appointed attorney fees

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 3:40pm
Order to Seal Psychosexual report as requested by Attorney Zarwell
Cover letter of Psychosexual Evaluation Report and copies of letter regarding defendant submitted by Attorney Zarwell
Copy of Letters regarding defendant submitted by Attorney Zarwell prior to sentencing
Sentencing hearing on February 17, 2017 at 02:45 pm.

[MK] case called at 1:48pm. 
Defendant John D Bruette in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Real-time reporting of the proceedings is being displayed on a monitor positioned on the defense counsel table in front of Mr. Bruette. The Court confirms with Mr. Bruette that he is able to follow the text displayed on the monitor screen. 
The Court reviews the Criminal Case Settlement form with Mr. Bruette, verifying that he understands and joins in the agreement. 
ADA Beck provides the factual basis for the Court to find that strong evidence of guilt exists, and for the Court to accept the intended Alford Plea of the Defendant.   
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; Plea of " No Contest" is entered by Mr. Bruette along with the addition that, on the request of Attorney Zarwell, the Plea is entered on all elements with the exception that, for the sexual contact-element of the crime, the Plea of "No Contest Under Alford " is entered.
Victim rights compliance is verified; ADA Beck indicates that the victim's father is present in the courtroom.
The Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Bruette guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On request of the Defense, the Court will schedule the sentencing hearing on a later date.  
The Court continues the Bond and conditions of release. 
recess 2:13pm. 

NEXT:  Sentencing Hearing on 2/17/17at 2:45pm. (Real-time reporting is needed)
Invoice from Dr. Freiburger - Approved for payment
Jury trial on February 6 & 7, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on February 2, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on January 20, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 2:03pm [ma]
Defendant John D Bruette in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Bruette is being assisted with use of Real Time monitor

Counsel verifies receipt of Doctor's Report

Atty Zarwell indicates not ready to resolve at this time; requests a FSSC and JT be scheduled.

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
--allow 2 days for Trial

The Court notifies Mr. Bruette of deadline to enter a plea
recess: 2:11pm

NEXT: (1)STC on 1/20/17 @ 130pm (2)FSSC on 2/2/17 @ 130pm  (3)Jury Trial on 2/6 and 2/7/17 @ 8:30am
Status conference on December 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

[MK] case called at 11:22am. 
Defendant John D Bruette in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
[Real-time reporting of the proceedings is being displayed on a monitor positioned on the defense counsel table in front of Mr. Bruette.]
This case is scheduled for Plea Hearing today. 
Attorney Zarwell indicates that he has met with Mr. Bruette after the previous attempted change-of-plea hearing, and that the Defense is now entering a dual plea of Not Guilty and Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect; the Defense requests an examination.

The Court clarifies with Attorney Zarwell that the previously tendered Guilty plea is withdrawn.  The Court receives the entry of the dual pleas of Not Guilty and NGI.  
On agreement of counsel the Court appoints Dr. James Freiburger to conduct the examination, requiring him to file the report on or before November 30th.    
The Court indicates that the Bond and conditions of release remain in effect. 
recess 11:28am. 

NEXT:  Status Conference on 12/6/16 at 1:30pm.
Plea hearing on October 27, 2016 at 11:15 am.

[MK] case called at 2:57pm. 
Defendant John D Bruette in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Real-time reporting of the proceedings is being displayed on a monitor positioned on the defense counsel table. 
The Court verifies with Mr. Bruette that he is able to read the real-time transcription.  
Both counsel confirm that they believe that Mr. Bruette is fully participating in the hearing with the assistance of the real-time transcription display. 

Attorney Zarwell submits paperwork related to a change-of-plea.
The Court reviews the Criminal Case Settlement form with Mr. Bruette, verifying that he understands and joins in the agreement.  
Counsel indicate that they are agreeing that the recommended sentencing condition that contact with the victim is prohibited be modified so that the condition be that there is to be no contact with the victim unless both the victim's parents and the Agent agree. 
Constitutional rights are reviewed.
As the Court reviews the elements of the crime and the facts in the Criminal Complaint with Mr. Bruette, Mr. Bruette expresses indecision and then he indicates that he did not commit the act of touching as alleged. 
The Court discusses with Mr. Bruette that the Court cannot accept the plea if Mr. Bruette says that the act did not happen.
recess 3:11pm, reconvene 3:48pm.  
Attorney Zarwell has now met further with Mr. Bruette, but he would like to have additional time to meet with Mr. Bruette about the change in plea. Attorney Zarwell voices that he does not expect the case to proceed tor trial; he is asking for a few more weeks to address the issues.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance.  The victim's parents are present.  
ADA Beck is not opposing the adjournment, citing that adjournment may effectuate a good record on a chage of plea.

When Attorney Zarwell requests that the next hearing be scheduled as a Plea Hearing only, the Court gives notice to the Defense that the Court will accept the plea if appropriate, but then the Court may revoke bail at that time.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court modifies the contact-prohibitions condition of the Bond to allow for written communication between the Defendant and RLH 
Bond and all other conditions of release remain in effect. 
recess 3:55pm. 

NEXT:  Plea Hearing on 10/27/16 at 11:15am (Real-time reporting display is needed)
Status conference on September 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Following the hearing Atty Zarwell returned to the Courtroom and requested that the preliminary hearing be moved to later in the day due to how long the Defendant has to travel. Court granted and Clerk provided Mr. Bruette with updated scheduling sheet.

Case called at 3:47 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant John D Bruette in court with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that they are not contesting the report and that they believe Mr. Bruette is competent
Mr. Bruette informs the Court that he believes he is competent
Court finds that Mr. Bruette is competent
Atty Zarwell requests the matter be set for preliminary hearing

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:15 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant John D Bruette in court with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Bruette indicates that the real-time is too fast. Court adjusts. Mr. Bruette informs the Court that he is able to read real-time at slower speed.
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that they agree that Mr. Bruette is not competent, Mr. Bruette agrees
ADA Shock informs the Court that the State also agrees that Mr. Bruette is not competent but is likely to regain competency in the statutory time frame
Counsel agree that Dr. Smith's report may be used as factual basis. Based upon the report of Dr. Smith and upon the positions of parties today, the Court finds that Mr. Bruette is not competent to proceed at this time, but is likely to regain competency. The Court suspends proceeds and commits Mr. Bruette to the custody of the department for a period not to exceed 12 months so that he may be brought to competency. Pursuant to statute the Dept. will determine type of treatment needed.
Recess: 3:22 pm
Proposed STAO for continuance of the 12/29/15 Competency Hearing

Case called at 3pm.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant John D Bruette in court with attorney David Zarwell.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews case history, status and filings - including verifying that the defendant is able to read the enlarged realtime as displayed.  (Defendant has significant hearing and vision issues.) 
Atty. Zarwell raises competence and request that the Court order examination; presents basis. 
State stipulates to factual basis for the examination. 
Court orders competency examination by DHS. 
Scheduling and procedural issues addressed by the Court and Counsel. 
Case continued for Competency Hearing on 12/29/15 at 1:30pm.
Bond continued by the Court. 

NEXT - (Notices to be mailed.) 
Competency Hearing on 12/29/15 at 1:30pm.
Letter from Attorney Zarwell ref prelim scheduled for 11-10-15
Proposed stip and order for continuance

Case called at 3:31 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant John D Bruette in court with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Real-Time Reporting being displayed for Mr. Bruette; After the Court enlarges the font, Mr. Bruette indicates that he can read the real-time
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that he believes that Mr. Bruette will be able to meaningful participate in today's proceedings
ADA Teuber: Agreed
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that there have been some negotiations, far apart at this time - still awaiting discovery. Do believe that scheduling a preliminary hearing is appropriate
Court informs parties that If there is bind over they should be prepared to go to arraignment at that time so the Defendant does not have to make a second trip
Court reminds Mr. Bruette that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending
Mr. Bruette confirms for the Court that he understood everything in today's hearing
Recess: 3:38 pm

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.

Began: 1:16 pm [Clerk SH]
[Honorable Judge David Wambach presiding for BrII]
John D. Bruette appears via video, in-custody from the Jefferson County Jail, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds probable cause within the probable cause statement to believe that Mr. Bruette commited a felony
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Mr. Bruette is severly deaf; Court informs Atty Svehlek that Mr. Bruette needs to be brought to the Courtroom so they can utilize real-time reporting
Ended: 1:18 pm 
John D. Bruette appears in-court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews for the record that Mr. Bruette was brought to the courtroom due to hearing issue, the Court reporter is displaying real-time reporting for Mr. Bruette
Mr. Bruette confirms that he can read/understand the real-time reporting
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that if a complaint is filed, then Mr. Bruette will not be eligible for SPD representation; have provided petition for court appointed counsel
Court again reviews that it has found probable cause
Bond arguments by Atty Flint - with request for 45 days to file complaint as charging decision has not yet been made

The Court requires a $10,000 signature bond with conditions: 
-No direct or indirect contact with A.C.H., M.M.H. or R.L.H.
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-No contact with any person under the age of 18
-Not leave State of Wisconsin

The Court grants the State's request of 45 days to file a criminal complaint and orders complaint to be filed no later than 4:00 pm on 7/24/15. If a complaint is not filed, then bond will lapse.
Ended: 1:57 pm

06-12-2015-Defendant is not eligible for SPD representation
